text: Gia Carangi (January 29, 1960 - November 18, 1986) was an American fashion model during the late 1970s and early 1980s. Many people believe she was the first supermodel. == Modeling career == Carangi was on the cover of fashion magazines, including many editions of Vogue and Cosmopolitan, and appeared in advertising campaigns for such fashion houses as Armani, Christian Dior, Versace, and Yves Saint Laurent. == Illness and death == Carangi, a heroin addict, died of AIDS-related complications at the age of 26. She was one of the first famous women to die of the disease. ==References== Category:1960 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Deaths from AIDS Category:Infectious disease deaths in Pennsylvania Category:Models from Pennsylvania Category:People from Philadelphia
title: Gia Carangi
